Dear Laurence,
I hope you're ready for next week's trip. I just want to check a few final details. Firstly, when you arrive, wait outside the station. Our driver will probably bethere to collect you, but he might notarrive until 5.30p.m. We've got a meeting in the afternoon and it may not finishon time. I'm sorry that I can't guarantee that I'll be there to meet you, especially as there could be a lot of traffic at that time.
We'll probably workmostly from the office, so youwon't needyour laptop. However, you might wantcopies of any important files you have. Also, wemay havethe chance to visit one of the factories, and the weather could be verycold, so bring a warm coat and a hat!
Lastly, you probably won'tneed very much money, but you could change some at the airport, just to be sure.
See you on Monday.
Regards,
Jim
